About UsReference GroupsWorking GroupsEnvironmental ScanNews & ResourcesContact usStay InformedAbout UsReference GroupsWorking GroupsEnvironmental ScanNews & ResourcesContact usStay InformedPhase One of our project has successfully concluded, and we are excited to announce the commencement of Phase Two. While we are not taking any more applications you can still register your interest below to stay up to date on the latest news & resources.Sign up for all the latest news and updatesFull NameEmail AddressWhat would you like to stay informed about?Sign upRegistration successfulYour information has been received, thank you for signing up to receive A Better Culture communications.  Spread the word and share Back to website
      
        
          
            
          
        

        
          
            
          
        
      
  Welcome to ABetterCultureA Better Culture is a coalition of health professionals who know that working in healthcare does not have to be traumatising. Who know that we can make things better. We can choose to eliminate bullying, to stamp out all forms of harassment, to have zero tolerance for racism, and to wipe discrimination off the face of the profession. We know that we can build #ABetterCulture. Dr Jillann FarmerChief Executive Officer    The Why Because none of these things have a place in a culture that is supposed to be about caring. Healthcare workers who are exhausted from the constant onslaught of bullying or from the oppressive weight of racism, can’t do their best work. Some of them leave – sometimes for a while, sometimes forever. And discrimination means that we don’t have a merit-based system – we aren’t ensuring that the best people do the work they are most suited for. Building #ABetterCulture will mean we build Better Healthcare. And that’s for everyone’s benefit.   What Makes A Better Culture Different? We are taking a different approach to creating a safer, more effective workplace. We are challenging the system, and those who drive it, to provide safety to the people in it. But it will take all parts of the health system to create lasting change. This is an invitation to everyone - Doctors, Nurses, Midwives and Allied Health workers, to be a part of creating psychological safety in a system and culture that currently undermines it. Healthcare must be accountable as a workplace. It must be safe first and foremost, then better outcomes for staff and patients will follow.The TeamKomal DarediaProject ManagerRead BioDr Sarah Jane SpringerSenior Medical AdvisorRead BioJade RamekaProject AdminRead BioMaddy RobertsProject AdminRead BioThe BoardDr Jillann FarmerOur CEORead BioMs Helen Szoke AOOur ChairRead BioDr Louis PeacheyAboriginal and Torres Strait Islander MemberRead BioDr Nicole HigginsCPMC MemberRead BioDr Karen StringerIndependent MemberRead BioCarly DoberAustralian Association of Psychologists MemberRead BioDavid ClarkeHealth Consumer Body MemberRead BioJudy FinnIndependent MemberRead BioDr Elise BuissonAMADT MemberRead BioKaren GraceNursing and Midwifery MemberRead BioDr Clare SkinnerCPMC MemberRead BioStay informedSign up for all the latest news and updatesFull NameEmail AddressWhat would you like to stay informed about? Sign up Signed up

We believe in eliminating bullying, racism, and discrimination to foster psychological safety for all health professionals. With a united front, we aim to ensure the best outcomes for both staff and patients.","headline":"Transforming Healthcare Workplaces for the Better","inLanguage":"en-au","mainEntityOfPage":"https://abetterculture.org.au/about-us/","name":"Transforming Healthcare Workplaces for the Better","publisher":{"@id":"https://abetterculture.org.au/#creator"},"url":"https://abetterculture.org.au/about-us/"},{"@id":"https://abetterculture.org.au/#identity","@type":"Organization","name":"A Better Culture","sameAs":["https://twitter.com/ABetterCulture","https://www.facebook.com/ABetterCulture","https://www.linkedin.com/company/abetterculture/","https://www.instagram.com/abetterculture.org.au/"],"telephone":"(03) 9088 7944","url":"https://abetterculture.org.au/"},{"@id":"https://www.brightlabs.com.au/#creator","@type":"Organization","name":"Bright Labs","url":"https://www.brightlabs.com.au/"},{"@type":"BreadcrumbList","description":"Breadcrumbs list","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","item":"https://abetterculture.org.au/","name":"Home","position":1},{"@type":"ListItem","item":"https://abetterculture.org.au/about-us/","name":"About us","position":2}],"name":"Breadcrumbs"}]}

We can choose to eliminate bullying, to stamp out all forms of harassment, to have zero tolerance for racism, and to wipe discrimination off the face of the profession. Healthcare workers who are exhausted from the constant onslaught of bullying or from the oppressive weight of racism, can’t do their best work. Some of them leave – sometimes for a while, sometimes forever. And discrimination means that we don’t have a merit-based system – we aren’t ensuring that the best people do the work they are most suited for. Building #ABetterCulture will mean we build Better Healthcare. And that’s for everyone’s benefit.   What Makes A Better Culture Different? We are challenging the system, and those who drive it, to provide safety to the people in it. But it will take all parts of the health system to create lasting change. This is an invitation to everyone - Doctors, Nurses, Midwives and Allied Health workers, to be a part of creating psychological safety in a system and culture that currently undermines it. Healthcare must be accountable as a workplace.
